A basic task that every site has: Enter your email to be added to our newsletter.  This should be very simple, but I can't find any documentation on it. Can someone point me in the right direction? I want to add a basic sign up form on the footer of our website.

This is not for a blog. We send out marketing newsletters, information updates on software releases, etc. I need them to subscribe to a basic marketing newsletter by simply providing an email address. We are using HubSpot for the email marketing platform

<https://www.HubSpot.com/products/marketing/forms>

Use forms to create a sign up form. Any form can be used to create a contacts list, which you can then use for your newsletter.
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/forms/create-forms>
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/lists/create-active-or-static-lists>
<@U7SL518D6> Hmmm....I was thinking I would need to add them to a specific subscription type (i.e. Marketing). Am I confusing subscription types with lists?

...and I assume that the steps are
1. Create the Form
2. Setup workflow to assign contact to a list
They do need to be added to a subscription type, yes, and one is required when sending an email
We do that by using a workflow as the forms don't have a setting to do it for you
<@UKGV272KS> Thank you! I just didn't want to make up my own process if there was something built-in.
hi, does anyone here used mailchimp with integration to HubSpot?

<@ULBP4M3LK> If you are just setting up a simple form to collect an email address for a newsletter sign up you can create a hidden form field in the form itself and set it to whatever subscription type you want.

The hidden field will not display on the form itself but the property will automatically be set for you. A little easier if you are unfamiliar with setting up workflows.
<@UQWGKUEN7>: I didn't even think of that; clearly my brain is done today.  Thank you so much, this is another good solution - and keeps everything together in one place.
